p: Shenzhen ( Fig 1) is located in the southern part of Guangdong Province and includes 10 administrative districts (Yantian, Luohu, Futian, Nanshan, Dapeng, Longhua, Longgang, Pingshan, Baoan, and Guangming). It is the central city in Chinaâ€™s economy, and its total economy ranks third in mainland China. Moreover, Shenzhen city, as an immigrant metropolis connecting China and Hong Kong, has a high population density and strong liquidity. These characteristics have also led to a high incidence of HFMD in Shenzhen over the years that is four times the national average [ 34].
